comment.author: 16071304@N00
comment._content: It looks like the point of this ride was that it rocked back and forth as the riders tried not to fall over: www.carouselroundabouts.co.uk/cakewalk.html

comment.author: 79334698@N00
comment._content: I hope they won cakes as prizes. That's what I remember about "Cake Walks" growing up.

comment.author: 94563365@N00
comment._content:
The cake walk I remember as a child was composed of two separate parallel boards that moved back and forth in opposite directions.  The object was to try and walk on these boards which involved timing and corredination.  You were considered a wussey if you held on to the rails for support.
  A Cake walk was oringinally a dance parody of ballroom dancing performed by slaves.later becoming fun fair like dance where participants dance in a circle to win a free cake.

comment.author: 22971393@N07
comment._content:
we still have an american cake walk in england
every year its at the great dorset steam fair
last time i went i took my nephew on it and no one else was using it
we were falling about so much and laughing we drew a crowd and they gave us free rides
it was amazing seeing cocky young men showing off to their girlfriends how easily they could walk it and then fall over
so much more fun than playstations
